name: Hungry Bear Cafe, Motel & RV Park

reviews.text: Of the four restaurants I ate in at/around the Forks area, this was my favorite. I ordered a salmon burger with a salad and was satisfied. The salmon tasted a little like what I buy and prepare for myself at home. Normally, I'd expect something more fresh, but for the area and because it reminded me of what I make at home, I was happy enough. The side salad was especially good. I really liked the mix of vegetables in it. My friend had salad and a shrimp basket. She received a HUGE portion (see pictures).
reviews.title: Favorite restaurant stop of the trip

reviews.text: My friend felt like service was a bit slow. I tend to agree, but I thought it was decent nevertheless. The waitress was friendly and helpful and took care of us. I give her extra consideration because she was the only one on the floor for much of the time.
reviews.title: Motel stay - do you like RUSTIC???

reviews.text: The peninsula was in the middle of peak tourist season and we couldn't find a place anywhere!! Hungry Bear Motel was "recommended" as a last possible accommodation for the area.
reviews.title: the hungry bear must have eaten the nice servers

reviews.text: We arrived late, and had to pick up the key from the restaurant. Not exactly friendly reception, but it was after 1030p...On entering our room #2, found two double beds, nightstand in between, a TV that didn't work and a fairly newly updated shower area. This room has seen a lot of travelers...my compliments on cleanliness. No extra amenities.
reviews.title: Overpriced, poor quality food

reviews.text: Furniture and bed worn. Mattresses sag and squeak...probably would of slept better on the floor. Shower stall is small, really small, but a strong stream of hot water offsets the lack of space to move around in. Towels and sheets are thin, but do the job.
reviews.title: Great place to stay.
